originalText.text: It was second time to visit.  You will like a beautiful and elegant style. There is many fashion jewelleries as well.

text.text: It was second time to visit.  You will like a beautiful and elegant style. There is many fashion jewelleries as well.

originalText.text:
Hilariously rude staff!

Attitude towards customers is like we shouldn’t be there. Instead of making my life easier when I’m trying to check out items and try on items, they ask me to be more careful, not to touch things, pressure me to put things back while they watch.

Items are also pretty low quality.

Items are also pretty low quality.

originalText.text: Bought a pair of linen shorts from here on vacation from Canada and they literally fell apart in one wear. I loved them initially and they fit perfectly so I  wore them *once*. I came home, did my laundry and laid them out to dry only to find that they are falling apart. Because I have misplaced my receipt, customer service said there’s nothing that can be done. What a waste of money and honestly pretty useless customer service/returns policy given that I still have the charge on my CC statement and images of the item before and after purchase and realistically they could help me if they wanted to. Very disappointing.

What a waste of money and honestly pretty useless customer service/returns policy given that I still have the charge on my CC statement and images of the item before and after purchase and realistically they could help me if they wanted to. Very disappointing.

originalText.text:
I came here on a Monday around noon. The store was chill, but there were still a few shoppers around. A nice amount of people to shop along next to.

They had a great fabric that was 89% Cupro 11% Elastane. It feels like button. Loved the fabric, hated the styles in the store.

I would have loved to have found a Cupro T-shirt in black or maroon. They have one online, so I might go for that.

Their sizing can be a bit tough for me. It feels inflated. Their smallest size, in many styles, is quite large.

I tried on:
-Organic Cotton T-shirt in Black
-Silk Button-down in Burgundy
-Leather Shorts in Black

The T-shirt and the silk shirt were both the smallest sizes, and too large on me. The shorts weren’t bad, but I didn’t love the gathered part at the top of the waist. Take that off and these would have been great leather shorts.

The quality on the silk shirt didn’t feel great. Just based on feel, I initially thought the shirt was polyester, and was surprised to see it say silk on the tag.

& Other Stories does tend to use unique fabrics for some of their styles. Like Cupro, or 100% wool T-shirts. They’re not the best quality (that’s what you get for the price), but I applaud their use of unique fabrics for basic styles. This is the one reason why I will occasionally check back in.

originalText.text:
When I entered this shop, four or five people were in the middle of the shop, blocking the path and chatting loudly. I initially thought they were customers and later on found out that they worked there.

I tried one dress and quite liked it. I asked a store person if they have the same design with different colours. She quickly checked her device and she said no. I looked around the shop for a bit and found the same dress with different colours so I went to the website and checked the dress and found that there are 5 different colours. What a useless staff.

One girl at the cashier was nice.

Don't ask anythinf to the staff who works at this shop. If you want to know more about sizing and products, go to the website. Sometimes, internet is smart and more helpful than human beings.
